docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
The TopologyOPT documentation site. You will find information, mathematical background and features for the three methods implemented:

  • Solid Isotropic Material with Penalisation (SIMP)
  • Bi-directional Evolutionary Structural Optimisation (BESO)
  • Level set method

docs.title: Mathematical problem
docs.text: The mathematical problem is a minumum compliance with volume restriction for 2D and 3D problems.

docs.title: Objective function
docs.text: The objective function is the compliance. Compliance is a form of energy inversely related to the stiffness of the part. If we want to maximise the stiffness, the problem needs to minimise the compliance.

docs.title: Design variables
docs.text: The design variable is the density of each element of the part.

docs.title: Constraints
docs.text: The physical constraint is the volume of the part. The user defines a volume fraction value target. Additionaly, the user can add geometrical and additive manufacturing restrictions.
